intro: Campylospermum klainei, commonly known as the Cape chestnut, is a shrub native to South Africa. It belongs to the Rhamnaceae family and is characterized by its small, pale yellow flowers and oval-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, woody fruits that contain one or two seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
